poem:
Title: "In the Web of Modern Wolves"

Iron fingers of unseen fiends, 
Coiled through tendrils of innocent light,
Mocking mother-love in silent screens,
Stealing blossoms in the dead of night.

The hound of Hell in a silicon shadow,
Behind blue-lit portals, woven to entrap;
Bordeaux roses plucked from the meadow,
Traded in the market of digital lap.

Beckons a bitter Paean, the new-age deceit,
Where angels pawn their wings for a stranger's treat.
